Install it!

If you don't already have QGIS installed, you can download it for free at download.qgis.org

Once you have QGIS installed, you can install InaSAFE in 5 easy steps! Open a recent version of QGIS (1.7 or better) and do:

  1. Plugins -> Fetch Python Plugins .
  2. Type InaSAFE in the Filter box.
  3. Tick the box next to the InaSAFE plugin.
  4. Click the Install/upgrade plugin button.
  5. Close the plugin manager and InaSAFE should be installed and ready to use.

Community

Join our mailing list by sending an email to inasafe-users+subscribe@googlegroups.com Source code available on GitHub!. Please file a ticket if you have discovered an issue.

About this project: This project is a collaborative effort between the Australia Aid Agency in Indonesia, the BNPB (Indonesia), the World Bank / GFDRR, the Australia-Indonesia Institure for Disaster Reduction, Universitas Gadja Mada and other participating organisations. The goal of this project is to create a tool that can provide rapid and relevant information in order to understand risk related to events such as volcanic eruptions, inundation from flood / tsunami, earthquakes and so on.
